Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Sleek looking. Seemed comfortable on the ears and head for the short time of use.
Cons: Horrid sound quality. This particular unit was obviously not refurbished properly. Low volume output from input device, lots of hissing, frequent crackling, practically no sound depth to speak of (very flat, not bass or clear treble). It sounds like $5 pair of headphones gone bad. The whole sound experience reminds me of a torn speaker cone. Also, the headset's plastic creaks a lot, even from subtle head movements. The refurbished box also did not come with the NiMH battery as stated, thankfully I had alk-AAA lying around.
Also I did try all three channels on the headset, and tried the headset using two different devices; computer and a mp3 player.
I never buy refurbish ... ed items of any sort due to fear of receiving a sub-par item. This purchase has solidified my thoughts on the matter. I took a leap in hopes that Sony would have done a better job. I have had Sony headsets in the past and enjoyed them.
If the replacement for this unit turns out to be the quality I expected, then this item will get more than 1 egg.
Despite the issues, Newegg performed it's end as expected. Fast processing and shipment. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Comfort, Price
Cons: Sound Quality
Let me say that perhaps this review is a bit harsh but i felt it needed.
The design of these headphones are pretty standard for wireless headphones to be honest... nothing good or bad. But the comfort behind these headphones are brilliant. I could wear these all day with no issues. I have no problems with the batteries or the design behind their charge base. I do wish their Y cable was longer perhaps 6 ft instead of the 3 ft you get.
I have one huge complaint against these headphones that I just can't tolerate and that is the Hiss as you would have guessed it. I tried it all, keeping the volume upon the headphones away from max, but increasing volume on the source. But the hiss is there, every song you start you will h ... ear it. Some times it goes, but with the start of each song it will return. Used during tv's or movies? You will hear the hiss while they speak, at least I did. Perhaps my hearing is too sensitive? I spent hours looking up equalizers everything to try and tweak my audio settings to remove that hiss, but you can't fully remove it. It's the technology behind their radio frequency, it'll always be there and i just can't stand it personally. It irritates me to death.
If you are sensitive to small things like the "hiss" I highly advise for you to avoid these headphones. If you don't mind it as much? Just want some quality wireless phones, go for it, they are worth the cash... so long as you can bear with ... "The Hiss" expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Signal range, rechargeable battery pack
Cons: Sound quality, weight
The FM transmission of these headphones is pretty terrible. The number one use of these for most people will be for the bedroom while their partner sleeps. As such, there isn't going to be much ambient noise to compete with, and keeping sound in the headphones is preferable. These do a decent job of keeping the sound within, but the quality of the sound is so bad that you're forced to turn it up just to hear the dialog. By turning it up to hear the dialog, you turn up the FM noise, and it gets to be unbearable. On the upside, lifting the headphones off your head cuts off the sound transmission, which is great for removing them in a quiet room and not disturbing someone else.

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: Great Wireless Headphones for the Money
Item.Review:
Pros: Crisp sound, comfortable fit
Cons: Large size
I have owned these headphones for a couple of years. This pair was for my 92 year old mother who has some hearing loss. She has had other headphones which were uncomfortable and were not as clear. This has really opened up a new world for her to watch TV and control the volume. As with most hearing loss, it is not necessarily the volume, but the clarity that is important. The Sony headphones are very clear. I compared prices with other brands, but since I have enjoyed mine so much I went with the Sony which has performed well for me. I have also recommended these to a friend who also has a hearing loss. He loves to watch his sports on TV now and he can adjust the volume.

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: Lots of static and scratchy noises
Item.Review:
Pros: Nothing
Cons: Everything
I bought these to use with the television, as I am a bit hard of hearing. There is a lot of static and scratchy noise with these headphones. Equally irritating was that you often needed to turn your head about 15 degrees away from looking at the television to minimize the static. These things are a disappointment. It came to a head when they would no longer charge and I thought I should first try replacing the batteries. It takes two special rechargeable Sony brand batteries, (about AAA size), that cost $34 each to replace!! I wasn't about to be taken advantage of again, so I bought a Sennheiser RS180 wireless headphones. They take ordinary AAA size rechargeable batteries and the sound is crystal clear. I'm not pleased with Sony.

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: That click you hear is not a defect, but it is
Item.Review:
Pros: Sony Name, nice charging/tramitter cradle
Cons: Auto On/Off switch design, sound quality needs to be improved
I purchased this to replace my "Sennheiser 120" wireless headphones which died after many years of solid service.
Overall the Sony 900MHz Analog RF Wireless Headphones set is a good value, if you can get past this wonderful, but irritatingly clunky feature: The "Auto On/Off" mechanism.
I thought that it was such a cool feature, and it is if you are using it to listen to music around the house. But my primary use for a wireless headset is at bedtime when I pop my "sleep DVD" in and set the timer and set the TV's brightness way down to lessen light in the room so I can drift off to sleep. But the "Auto On" feature is actually a physical switch tha ... t activates when the speaker cups are pulled down into position over the ears (and when pushed up, the unit turns off). This is great, unless you happen to be in bed or have your head on a pillow or on a rest. Small moves of your head or the speaker cups will turn the unit off and you must move the cups to turn it back on and there is a loud, disconcerting "pop-crack" sound that can be shocking when you are trying to doze off or in the day when you relaxing but have the volume turned up much louder than you would in bed. After about a week of this craziness, I went and ordered a new "Sennheiser" 120. The sound on the "Sony 900MHz Analog RF Wireless Headphones" was not great, either. It was like all mid-range and not much at the highs and lows. Voice was also disappointingly poor. Another issue is the radio channel selection. You get 3 channels to select from, but if you do not get good reception on any of them, it can be anywhere from irritating to down right annoying. If you have that issue, I suggest you get a set that has an analog tuner. Even though it is limited to a "single frequency," you can go a little higher or lower than the band to get the best reception But the "Sony 900MHz Analog RF Wireless Headphones" do work, have a good range from the transmitter and are comfortable for about an hour before starting to fee ... expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural

I bought this for my husband to replace his old one. He uses it to watch tv & I've used it for that as well. Very comfortable to wear with automatic adjustment fit for each of us. We've alternately used it all day long & still kept its charge!

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: Nice if you do not like bass
Item.Review:
Pros: Excellent range
Cons: Bass response, external noise
I picked these up because I was tired of running over my cable with my chair where I work. Another coworker has a set that I briefly tried out before picking up mine, which sounded pretty decent for the few minutes I listened. Once I got everything setup the audio quality quickly became an issue. There is virtually no bass response in these headphones unless you are playing music that has the bass leveled perfectly. If you go just a little too high or too low, you get either no bass at all or distortion beyond belief. Most of this is due to the way the digital signal has too be compressed for over the air transmission.
There seems to be some issue with picking up external noise, even when the transmitter is 3 fe ... et away. I know when people are getting cell phone calls because I hear the noise before their phone rings.
If you have more than one set of these headphones in your general area, it can be a little tricky figuring out how to set them up. Basically set your transmitter to one of the three channels, then press the Tune button repeatedly until you tune to your transmitter. Each time you press Tune, it switches your headset to the next channel. My coworker and I were doing battle for a little while until we figured out what was going on.
All and all they are not bad headphones for what they are, but the price may be a bit steep for the poor audio quality. expand » « collapse

Item.Review:
Pros: Reception clarity, ease of use
Cons: Nothing
I've been using the Sony for ~3 weeks for TV/DVD viewing and they work great in my house (wiring and location of equipment probably effects this greatly). The reception range is more than adequate and I don't have a static problem at all. The channel button feature works very well when I move to a location with lesser reception ... just press repeatedly to cycle through the channels and clear reception is guaranteed. No setup hassle at all.
I LOVE the automatic on/off feature ... turns on when wearing, turns off when not wearing. Great battery charge saver.
A great value.

I purchased these for my grandma and she loves them. She could never hear the tv before she got these. She wears hearing aids so she cant hear very well but when she put these on she heard everything perfectly. She said she hasnt heard the tv so well in years. Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: Solved a real problem in our household.
Item.Review:
Pros: Good sound quality, easy to use.
Cons: Instructions are lacking & long initial charge up period
I bought these as a gift for my elderly mother who won't wear hearing aids and could not hear her TV without blasting the volume. At night she would use closed captioning but that does really limit the viewing experience for her.
She's not a fan of "techie" things but she is really liking these. She can easily adjust the sound level to her needs. Very comfortable, LOVE the fact that they turn off when removed from your head and turn back on when you put them on. Makes it really easy for her and really saves on battery life. Wireless and rechargable. Very easy to charge; just pop them on the base.. She pops them on the charger when she won't be using them for a few ... hours and we haven't had any shortage issues.
By biggest complaints are: 1) the instructions were not very clear. Luckily I have some experience in HT and how things are connected. 2) The 16+ hour initial charge up time.
But other than those two issues, they are working like a dream and she's very happy to be able to listen to music, watch movies and her programs and actually hear what is going on. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: Though I like the feel of the headphones, after 30 minutes of having them on my head I knew there was no I was keeping them. I thought it might be that I was listening to streaming radio, but I switched to iTunes and the noise persisted. I have returned these and will stay away from wireless for a few more years. Also, whatever spring device they used for the headband to fit your head makes an annoying rusty spring sound when stretched normally. Don't buy!

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Style, comfort, design concept
Cons: Performance, QC
Right-channel dead (out of the box) and noisy reception with the left. Tried reversing the cable and all of the usual simple tricks and the right channel is simply dead (don't they check these things?).
On the noise issue, tried all three frequencies, same results. Some hiss with clicks and pops. Not what one would likely put up with while watching a movie. The 900 MHz band with an anemic transmitter along with analog FM modulation is probably the reason.
I really like the design concept and the comfort of these headphones. The QC is very shaky and I am currently looking at other options.

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Wireless, great sound, stylish design, Sony quality
Cons: Could be a tad less expensive...but great quality
I bought these headphones earlier this week from Best Buy. Like those of you reading this review I researched and read other reviews and saw the same 1 star reviews many had written about this product. However, I decided to get these anyway hoping to have better luck....I am so happy I did!
These headphones work great and look great too! I live in an apt. and haven't really tested the range on these but I love that they are wireless (main reason I bought them) and I am having no problems at all. I have a sony home theater system and everything (plasma hdtv, cable box, PS3) has sound going into that. I also have a D-link wireless router about 1 ft. away from ... the headphone's transmitter too and no issues.
**I followed the advice I read about turning up the volume on the source higher (in my case, my sony surround sound system) and keeping the volume selector on the headphones lower instead of maxed out and it works like a charm...perhaps others aren't doing this?? Sometimes when i turn them on I get a little static but thats why the tuning button is there on the right side...one press of the button and it's gone.
I dont know what the deal is with the negative reviews but I am very happy with my purchase. I guess since they are wireless the functionality and performance will vary depending upon each individual's surrounding environment and amount of interference present. I'm not an audiophile and this is the first pair of nice headphones I have ever bought for home entertainment and I am very happy with the quality of my purchase. Now I can watch movies or play COD Black Ops without disturbing anyone and listen as loud as I want WIRELESSLY! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: Everything about this wireless headphone says it's the answer. Subsequently, I get a lot of static in certain locations in my apartment and orientations, but that's because I live in a built-up urban environment. It might take some more tweeking to mitigate the static noise. For more rural settings, I think this will be perfect. The headphones are very comfortable, and the device is convenient in that in turns on (and off) automatically. Do be advised, buyer, these are not noise-canceling headphones. But they still output great sound quality. I would recommend them--a great value at their price. ...

I've had other wireless headsets (Advent) that had static and wandering channels but the Sony headphones' sound quality is excellent and the channel lock is solid. I can we ... ar them for hours without discomfort. I also own a pair of TV Ears which are smaller, lighter and hang from your ears. They are uncomfortable to wear and no match in sound quality. ... expand » « collapse

These are the worst headphones I've ever used. The sound was tinny and it couldn't even handle the smallest amount of bass before becoming a crackly mess. It was merely passable for voice audio. I'll be returning these immediately. It's hard to believe that Sony could stoop to sticking their logo on this product.
Also, why can't it just have an On/Off switch like every other electronic device? The auto on/off thing was awkward and didn't always work immediately.

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Nothing
Cons: Expensive, poor sound quality & expensive battery replacement
For years I've had wireless headphones connected to each of my TV's. When one set finally began failing, I went to Best Buy to replace them. Unfortunately, BB only carried the Sony set. I read the reviews and should have taken them to heart. Sony quality is not what it use to be. The headphones were tinning, and not very clear. They also require a special Sony battery pack, that I researched and found to be quite expensive. Save your money and go get RCA. They are 1/4th the price and work flawlessly.

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: Great for those a little/lot Hearing Impaired
Item.Review:
Pros: Wireless at a Great Price
This is the second set I have purchased, one for the living room and now one for the bedroom. My husband no longer blasts us out of the room with the volume. They are comfortable and have easy to use controls. I would highly recommend these Sony Wireless Headsets to anyone that is having to turn up the volume because of hearing loss.

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: The sound
Cons: The batteries get loose in the headset, so you have to mess with the one ear so the green light on the base comes on.
This headset had a good pricetag, and I typically like Sony products, but this particular product has not met my expectations. I previously had a Sennhouser for many years until the sound quality went caput. I've only had this for a month, and I am already disappointed. Not so much with the sound quality, but with the ambient noise, no matter which channel I switch it to. But the main disappointment is, they don't always work. Sometimes when I take the headset off the base, the green light doesn't go on, therefore no sound. Then I have to mess around with it in order for the green light to go on, which can be frustrating. Maybe I just got ... a bad one, but it was the last one on the shelf. If I return it to the store for an exchange, and have better luck with a different one, I will change my review. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Excellent sound quality; easy set-up; replaceable battery; easy to re-charge
Cons: Seems a little bulky
I purchased the headphones for my husband to use while watching tv. He is very pleased with the quality of the sound and the ease of use. he also likes the automatic turn-on/off feature. They were on sale at the time of my purchase so the value was outstanding.

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy set up, comfortable, good sound quality
Cons: Good, not great sound quality
Purchased for home fitness use so that the TV would not need to be blasting when using the elliptical or bike on a resistance wheel. We like the ease of use and performance we purchased a second wireless headset so both my wife and I would have our own. Sound quality is good (not great)...but it sure beats trying to hear TV dialog over the sound or work out equipment. Because these are over the ear headphones, its natural that you are going to sweat...so we ordered 100 Large Sanitary Headphone Covers, Black, from Scan Sound which work perfectly over these headphones! The recharging cradle is very useful, convenient.

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: When they work, they are awesome.
Item.Review:
Pros: Hearing everything - especially for someone hard of hearing
Cons: Doesn't always work on left ear.
Sound and comfort is awesome. Great for working out on the treadmill. However, I have had several pairs and the left side continues to go out on each set. It will come back in sometimes after a week or so, but it is constantly a problem. Must be a defect in design. If they could fix this, these could sell like gangbusters if demoed in the store

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: EVERYTHING
Cons: NOTHING
I love the way they just sit in the charger, no wire to connect. Most comfortable fit of any ears I've had! Sound quality is great.

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Nice design
Cons: No matter how I setup the headphones there was not way to eliminate interference
Sound quality is extremlly poor. this device cannot deal with outside interference.

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
decent sounding for being wireless headphones. They kill batteries fast though.
I think there are other options that sound as good but have longer battery life.

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: MDR-RF970RK - Wireless RF Stereo Headphones by Sony are a good buy. I use them mostly for listening to the TV late at night. Virtually no static or interference. Quite comfortable. Decent sound. It's a decent product at a decent price. If you're expecting Dr. Dre quality you won't find it here....but then again you're not paying Dr. Dre prices either.

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: Great Product at a Great Price
Item.Review: I use these to watch my 55 Samsung LCD TV when I don't want to disturb others in a nearby room. The sound is clear with great tonal quality and they have good range no matter where I move in the room. I'm hearing background sounds on shows that I never noticed before while watching without the headphones. B&H's price was fantastic too - over $40 cheaper than [...]. I definitely recommend these to anyone. They're comfortable too.

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Range as advertised
Cons: Virtually Everything
Very dissatisfied with this item. Its failings began to show shortly after it was too late to return it to the store. Recharging system failed within months of purchase. After one year the head strap on/off switch became touchy. After 3 years an apparent internal short causes all batteries to discharge overnight. Being bald I find the on/off strap approach uncomfortable against bare skin. Tilting your head slightly causes significant noise in the signal. There is a constant background noise noticable when no sound from the TV. There's got to be a better set than these.

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I consider myself better than average on today's technology. I purchased these on a whim and expected the gamble. I have a small house and I needed these not to wake my wife up in bed or my son up in the next room. My gamble loss. I kept them for 2 weeks before I returned them. I could not get clear sound. I had a constant tick about every 5 seconds. Very frustrating. I placed the transmitter in ll different areas and directions, still no luck. Complaint 2 every other day on average the signal would get lost causing a loud screeching sound in your ear. That was bad especially when you would be falling asleep. I definately do not recommend these. I can't believe Sony released these on the market. I splurged and ordered the sennheiser 160's today and am going to try those out. Hope this help ... ed . expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: They are very comfortable and fit in the charger well
Cons: They suck.
For the first 4 or 5 months they worked pretty well as long as I didn't go more than 20 feet away. Now, they make a terrible popping sound and go dead for a second about every 5 minutes. I can't seem to figure it out, they are fully charged and last for hours, but just keep popping. It is extremely annoying. I would recommend you buy something a little nicer.

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy to Use and Recharge, Works as it Should
Cons: Rubber can start sweat after long hours of wear
I've had this product for a couple of months now and this is the only wireless that I've ever been completely happy with. Previous items just didn't seem to work at a decent distance. This meets its specs. I was looking for a 5.1 or 7.1 device but it came only in Gaming headware but this has virtual surround sound.
It doesn't lose its signal like many others do. I've always preferred Sony products and this item maintains their standard. The price is certainly fair. I haven't had any problems with the 900MHz either. Our house phones are 5.2GHz.

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: There are a lot of reviews here that are misleading because the whiners don't give you the full story. A 27' travel trailer is measured from the end of the tongue to the back of the rear bumper and rounded up to the next even foot. Sony probably does a similar range test with this unit in an open field. its the way all things are measured...absolute best conditions, so live with it. Nothing deceptive. As with all thing wireless, range is not determined by the device but obstacles it must deal with. The batteries are a standard AA NM rechargeable at any Walmart. Been there done that. One headset at a time in the broadcast area...2 or more doesn't work well. Doesn't work as desired on my CRT TV (old technology)but is a dream on my HDTV. I can mute that TV and listen at the volume I want..no ... static, no interference. Bad reviews are often from stupidity and/or higher than reasonable expectations of a product to do something it wasn't designed to do. Got a friend one and he is in headphone heaven. We both have hearing issues. For MY needs it is a dream answer, with no issues expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: the worst headphone I've ever buy
Item.Review: For 3 dollars with but wire a wire, you can buy better sound. There is two main problem with this headphone. First, my wifi network for internet make interference with the headphone. And even if I disconnect my ADSL box, the interference stop in my room, but in the kitchen, my neighboor's box interfer. How a brand like SONY can imagine wireless headphone so sensible to the internet wifi connection. Second, the cups are made in several piece of ABS. Every movement of your face will be imediately traduce by squizzing sound in you ears. Buy this afternoon at 4 pm, I will bring it back tomorrow at 9 am. Avoid this product.

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Price
Cons: Makes your ears swet when wearing long periods
I bought these about 6 months ago, loved them so much bought another one a month later. You do hear static, but rarely, it was easy to set up. The only complaint is that wearing them for a long period, your ears swet, so I just cut out a round piece of tee shirt material and gum band them around the ear pieces, works like a charm. The price is really good, I am considering buying two more, for when the other ones stop working. I am hard of hearing and wearing these does not disturb anyone, I can have them as loud as I want and keep the TV down to a whisper. Great product, great price.

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Wireless
Cons: Can't adjust quality
I love these headphones. They are the best headphones I have had. The only thing I don't like is that you can't adjust the bass on them,

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: Great device, nothing bad, no problems
Item.Review:
Pros: EVERYTHING
Cons: NOTHING!
I reviewed everyone's complaints about it turning off, and bad sound, but I don't see it. I hear a little bit of scratchy noise, but its definitively worth the price.

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: If you like crisp highs and pounding lows
Item.Review:
Pros: Didnt even know they were on my head.
Cons: Sound
Cant use these, Initial charge time 16 hours. Woke up this morning to rock out these new headphones. The high sounds would be great without the hissing and screeeching in the background (Heavy Metal - 3inches of blood). So I tried 50cent to see about the lows and the set didnt perform to my standard.
If you feel like moving the base around to get better signal and reduce the hissing etc... this set is for you. Im going back to get the 20$ Sony headphones.

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: For starters, it was the only wireless headset offered at the store, then I ended up exchanging only to end up returning the 2nd one as well. Signal kept failing to transmit every 10 minutes or so and the headphones would abruptly shut off with loud static-like crashing sound. I would have to get up and unplug/plug the transmitter. Not good when trying to fall asleep.

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Can now watch TV and hear better / not bother others.
Cons: Slight static pops and figuring out where to put the stand.
I have a roommate who has to work early and these headphones let me catch up on DVR shows late night without bothering him.
I'm using them with my new Samsung LEDTV. They do the job, and the sound is ironically clearer than the TV's speakers, which are on the back of the LEDTV (facing his wall), somewhat muffled unless you have the volume up.
I actually prefer to watch movies with them--even when I don't need to be quiet, but care about hearing every detail of the sound.
I initially plugged the stand/charger/transmitter into my Directv box, as was suggested on here, but I didn't get Bluray/DVD sound. So I'm plugging them into the " ... audio out" jack behind the TV, which gets everything you see on your TV.
My only complaint is I can see the base of the stand at all times, just beneath the TV frame. My LEDTV swivels on the stand it comes with in my media cabinet. So I have to swivel the TV to get the headphones in or out. No big deal--this is fairly discrete and it's worth it. But I wish the audio cords it came with were longer and I could place it somewhere else--on a shelf above for example.
The reception does have static buzzes or "zaps" now and then--every 20-30 seconds or so I'd say. But it's not that bothersome to me. It may be interference from my Airport Extreme wireless internet router, which is set up on the floor below.
It's true the headphones don't breath much, but it's only a problem if I end up watching several hours with no breaks. I usually only use them from 10pm to midnight (or so...) expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Sound, Distance, Price, Rechargeable, Lightweight
Cons: A little big
I use these sony headphones at my work place. they work great sound is clear whether im streaming radio from my computer or listening to my MP3 player. It has rechargable batteries thats a good feature and the batteries have never gone out on me when i usually listen to it for 6-10 hours at a time. It does shut off some times when you hang them around your neck which i dont like but other then that and the Size they work great.

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Sound Quality, Comfort, Ease of Use
Cons: Could be redesigned to look smaller
I have a great surround sound system but there are TV shows that the music is louder than the spoken word. I have a little hearing issue with certain frequencies so a friend had gotten one of these and really liked it so they bought one for me for Xmas. I pretty much refused to listen to it because it might acknowledge my hearing issue but I gave in. Wow.... I hear everything now... from the door opening and closing in the background to every instrument on American Idol. When they are are whispering to each other on Survivor, I hear it. When there are things going on in the background on the left or right side, it sounds like surround sound. I can even hear my wife when she asks me a question ... while listening to a show so I'm not totally disconnected from my family. I've given this unit to others and they constantly thank me for it. It turns itself off and on automatically when you put it on or take it off... saves battery life. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: Being of older age I lost my hearing of high frequency tones . When watching TV I turn the volume up and my wife turns it down where it's very difficult for me to hear. These headphones are Great. I couldn't believe the differance in my hearing and understanding all the dialog now without disturbing my wife. She sets her volume level on the TV and I set mine on the Suround Sound Reciever and all is well. I like the feature of the set turning off when the headphones are removed, it saves the batteries. I find it easier to use AAA alkaline batteries rather then the charagable ones provided. They give about 22 hours of listining. This product is GREAT. I would recomend these for anyone wanting to hear more clearly.

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: My First earphones for television audio
Item.Review:
Pros: Can walk all over the house and hear TV sound
Cons: N/A
I got these earphones so that I wouldn't bother my sister when I watch television at odd times. However, I use them when she isn't in the house. I'm older and I can hear the televsion audio better through the earphones than from the TV speakers.

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: This product saved my marriage. We have 2 pair
Item.Review:
Pros: Clear sound. Long lasting. Vol control separate from the TV
Cons: Need to replace earpads and can't finid replacements at Sony or Best Buy
My husband has 2 pair of these. A set at each of our homes (one a vacation home). We have used them for over 4 years and would not be without them.. My husband wears hearing aids but stil has trouble with hearing clearly what is being said on the TV. These are the greatest thing for that. He also puts them on and goes upstairs to walk on the treadmill after tuning in his favorite satellite radio station. Wonderful !!! The best thing is he can adjust the sound on his headphones while having the sound nuted on the TV. This product allows me to be reading in the same room he is watching TV. Saved our marriage !!! I willnot be without th ... em. For those of you having issues, I suspect that it is the way you have them hooked up. Do Not plug them into the earphone jack on your TV. You will not be able to control the volume separately that way. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: NOTHING
Cons: DOES NOT CONECT CONSISTENTLY
WORKED ONCE. HAVE TRIED SEVERAL TIMES TO RECONNECT BUT NOTHING BUT NOISE/STATIC SQUEAL. HAS ABSOLUTLY NO VALUE. PERHAPS WITH OTHER ELECTRONICS IN MODERN HOMES THIS TYPE OF OF EQUIPMENT DOES NOT WORK. WILL NOW RETURN. USED AN AUDIO RESEARCH MODEL BEFORE AND IT WORKED PERFECTLY.

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Sound quality is fantastic!!!!
When I wear these riding a stationary bike while watching TV, I can hear the TV loud and clear and it sounds just like the stereo/surround sound that we have. Absolute great deal.

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: Make sure your TV has a headphone jack.
Item.Review:
Pros: Comfortable and easy to use.
Cons: Short cords require it to be right next to the TV.
I bought this to use in our bedroom to watch TV while my partner is sleeping. Our TV is brand new and does not have a headphone jack. We had to connect it to our Bose system, which works well, but not ideal.
Make sure that whatever you are going to connect it to has a headphone jack for easy use. Otherwise you will need to use RCA plugs from an output jack.
Works great. Recharges automatically. No batteries to replace.

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Great look, charger/holder.
Cons: Not great sound.
Could not eliminate "echo" type sound and interferance. Only 3 channel choices without "fine tuning" feature. Returned the unit because I couldn't get rid of interference type sounds, and also sounded like an echo and not clear reception.

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Comfortable; Great Sound; Lightweight
I use them for watching tv. I am hard of hearing and they work great. I now can hear plainly what is being said, but they are hot to wear

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: These headphones are pretty good when they work, both quality and range. But unless you use them daily, you absolutely cannot rely on the rechargeable battery. If you use the headphones at exactly the moment a recharge is complete, it will work fine. But if you have not used them for several days, but left the headphones in the cradle (supposedly to recharge as needed), they will NOT continuously recharge. In fact, they will almost always be dead. Not a very good design. I have many Sony devices with rechargeable batteries that never lose a charge until the battery gets old (my wireless phone and my rechargeable universal remote control). But this Sony item seems to have missed that design session.

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: the sound
Cons: It is very breakable
Bought this for my Dad for Christmas. Had to replace it by July because the plastic housing is not at all durable. Drop it a few times and it snaps in half. The sound works well, but it can't withstand a fall.
Thanks Sony, garbage product.

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: comfortable & easy
Cons: a tiny bit of static in the sound
I gave these to my Dad for Father's Day. He REALLY LIKES THEM. You get a bit of static sound but hear quite fine. They are comfortable to wear. Easy to install. I highly recommend this item.

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: No room for home theater so these headphones are the perfect accessory to add high quality stereo sound to my HDTV. Great boost for my ageing ears. Easy installation. Good noise cancellation. Quality product. Occasional pop and whistle, but of little concern; wish the headphones were a bit more comfortable; using these in a stationary position only 4 ft from transmitter so not sure how satisfactory these would be if wandering around the house. Price much lower from B&H than elsewhere.

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: Great sound, amazing quality. Definitely a great purchase that I can hand down to my sons and there sons. A true keep safe, wow. Always remember these headphones. Timmy

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: wireless
Cons: reliability
I've owned this Sony product for 11 months, but it died on me about 4 months ago. It wasn't from overuse because they were used very sparingly, primarily when I was watching a program while my wife was working in the same room. Thought it might be the battery so I purchased a replacement battery from Amazon. The new battery changed nothing. Since it died outside of the 180 day warrantee, they are now headed for the trash. Not happy wiht throwing out a $120 set of head phones that are under a year old.

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: Best Selection available in This Catagory
Item.Review:
Pros: Range is really great.
Cons: A little static once in a while.
So far it has been much better at defeating interference than my previous RocketFish wireless product. It still isn't as bullet proof as a wired headset but man the range is really great and sound quality is above average.

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: Product Review for Sony MDR-RF970RK Wireless Stereo Headphone
Item.Review: I love these headphones, I can hear each word clearley now and I don't bother anybody with have the sound on the TV turned up. This is the 2nd set I have now (1 in the living room, 1ini the bedroom)

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: decent sound quality, works exactly as it's supposed to
Cons: nothing so far
Bought these for use in our bedroom so either my wife or I could watch TV (Toshiba 24: HDTV) at night without disturbing the other person. Set up was no problem. Attached the transmitter to the outputs on the cable box. Charged the headphones for 16 hours (overnight) and followed the instructions. Headphones worked perfectly (touched the channel selector on the 'phones and it immediately found the transmitter) and the wireless transmission carried from the second floor of our home where the bedroom is to the basement. These aren't audiophile headphones and for under $100 I wouldn't have expected that...but the sound quality is very good with more then enough volume. Very happy with this purchas ... e. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: They are very comfortable and loud.
Cons: They sound staticy.
Although they are the most comfortable headphone i have ever warn. I use them in a cubical all day and the transmitter is about 10 feet away over a cubical wall. They get static in them for no apparent reason, not sure if it is the way the unit receives the signal or what, but they make a lot of static. I have used every single channel and one is a little better, but don't go behind a wall, if cube walls are high, find something else. Line of sight is important with this product. I won't take them back because they preform ok, and i don't want to deal with the hassle. I would find something in bluetooth. I use for my XM system and i wish it had bluetooth installed. The audio is very good. You get a ton of sou ... nd, just watch you line of sight or the way you sit. At 20 feet with line of sight i still have sound, 30 is also good. That is the furtherst i have been. 15 with no line of sight, forget it. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy charging cradle
Cons: Sound is very flat.
I might keep it since it's mostly just for tv, but I do like to listen to the comcast music stations; so maybe not. The sound quality is flat. I think I read someone else describe it as tinny. I agreee with that description. I turned the bass up on my tv and that helped a little, but the sound just seems artificial. On the plus side, I'm not getting any interference or hiss as others have reported until I get further away into other rooms. Then it might hiss or pop a little. I like the easy of placing the headset in the cradle. The red charge light is easy to see and the arrows pretty much line up by themsleves.

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: easy to charge, auto on and off , great dynamic range for TV use and just all around no bother to use - all of the transparent functionality you want from an item like this and very comfortable to wear.
Much simpler to use than the Stenseiser (sp) type I have also purchased here which are fine but not as user friendly.
Cons: came back to buy a 2nd pair and they are out of stock/ discontinued.

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Comfort
Cons: Sound
For over a hundred dollars these headphones shouldn't hiss, click, or fade out. Sound would also drop out and all of this was from just 15' away. On the positive side, very light and comfortable and the rechargeable batteries is definitely a plus.

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Comfortable, nice clear sound.
Cons: Poor instructions.
Out of the box easy to install battries, only problem was connecting them to the TV. after two hours could not get a sound out of them, tried various outputs on TV still no sound, exchanged them for another set thinking they were faulty, still had the same probs with second set, tried setting them up on my Computer worked fine, eventually I set them up via my cable box, perfect sound came through the headphones. Nice clear sound with no distortion or buzzing, even wore them out in the garden many feet from the receiver and still a good clear sound. I now know that I am electronic stupid.

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Looks good.
Cons: Doesn't work well.
First day sounded great. Then sound goes on and off. Lots of static and popping. Thought it was too close to another electronic. Not. Have tried everything. Poor quality. Not happy.

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: Automatic turn on/off is flawed engineering.
Item.Review:
Pros: Automatic on/off switch is a good idea.
Cons: Automatic on/off switch engineering is flawed.
Tried two of these with an exchange and both have the same problem with the automatic on/off switch that is activated by stretching the overhead band when putting the phones on and off. Sound abruptly keeps cutting in an out whenever I turn or move my head. I am taking the second set back today and will stay away from the Sony automatic on/off earphones this time. I cannot really judge the sound quality because of the abrupt cutting in and out. If picking out two of these earphones is not just an unlikely but unfortunate coincidence, this product should be taken off the shelf until the switch is reengineered.

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: Too much variable hiss and static
Item.Review:
Pros: Auto-on/off Feature,Comfortable,Light Weight,Rechargeable
Cons: Poor Sound Quality - Inconsistent High Frequency Hissing
These headphones are horrible. I followed the directions exactly as indicated. I plugged it in and let it charge until the indicator went off (about 17 hours). I made sure no cables were crossed and the transmitter was in a good isolated location. It's all for not as the sound received by the headphones is inconsistently noisy depending on how subtle the sound is and how you hold your head. And yes, I tried all three channels, the auto tuning button, moving the transmitter around -- everything suggested in the manual. These headphones just don't work well.

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: I would buy this product again
Item.Review: I am very happy with the headphones. I returned another major brand set that operated on batteries, however, the batteries only lasted about 4 hours before the batteeries needed to be replaced. I also love the feature that the headphones go off automatically when you remove them,which is a great way to save the rechargablo batteries life.

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Great sound and is wireless
Cons: Primitive cable hookup
I like the wireless headphones very much. I had a little trouble hooking the base unit to the TV - cable box, and the blu ray because the headphone base unit only has One 3.5mm Stereo Male To Two RCA Stereo cable connection. Fairly primitive for this day and age. I did figure out a way to make it work but it is not the ideal solution.

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Nothing
Cons: 2 sets both very poor product.
We ended up buyed two sets two weeks apart. Had to return the first set because they kept poping then sutting off. No pattern on time we could use them for 2 hours. At other times within 5 to 10 minutes a cracking/pop sound and off the set would go.
We kept the 1st set for 2 weeks. Try to figure out what in the world would be causing this issue. Returned to best buy. We figured we just got a lemon set.
2nd set the exact same thing!! That set we returned within 3 days.
Would not recommend. And from SONY?? My word...

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: Easy use. Previous Sony, 10 or 12 years old, still worked and sound was great but switch was above the ear, thus any motion cut the sound off. These phones have switch in the head band. They work no matter what you are doing anywhere inside or outside. Sound is good. Couldn't ask for more.

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: These are good headphones, the sound quality is outstanding and the noise canceling works very well. They are a little bigger than most so laying down with them on is a bit tough. They are great for work applications .

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: Listening to TV programs with the MDRRF970RK is very poor. The sound simply stops coming through the headphones for about 1-2 seconds of silence. This happens at random times and is very annoying. Most people will NOT be happy with these headphones!

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: Great headphones. The sound is great. I have a couple of small issues. 1.the instruction should read when you first install, that the headphones don't work until you put them on. 2. The transmitter does not come on until it senses sound. 3. The earpiece makes some squeaking noises that, at times can become distracting.

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: Great sound but squeaks ruin it!
Item.Review: My wife tried these for listening to TV while working. Sound is great until you move your head and you get a major plastic on plastic squeak from the frames. It makes them unusable unless you are going to be sitting still.

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: Terrible creaking sound from the plastic parts
Item.Review: Just got the headphones and was very impressed except...... whenever you move the earpads in any way, there is a very loud creaking sound. The plastic hinged part needs to be lubruicated or trimmed or something. The support line says the only way to fix it is to send it in for repairs which means being without them for who knows how long. I will be returning them and purchasing a different brand as customer support was not very helpful and I have to order them from out of town and cannot try them before I buy them. I DO NOT recommend buying these unless you can try them in the store first.

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: This product lives up to its stated use.
Item.Review: I love almost everything about this product. I own two other wireless headphones, one cost quite a bit more than this one and this one well out performs that unit. The only little thing wrong with this unit is that when I place it in the cradle to recharge I have a small problem getting it to connect to recharging. I have to play with it some to get it to connect. But this is a small problem.

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: I can hear my TV now. Very easy to wear!
Cons: Nothing yet...
I have Grand kids in my house and I wanted to be able to watch TV in the early morning or late night without waking them. I can watch TV with the TV volume down all the way but hear my shows fine. Also, with everyone up I can have the TV volume at a normal level for everyone else but louder for my taste in my ears. It was very easy to connect to my TV. One thing that is cool, they turn on automatically when you put them on. These Headphones are great for the money!

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Piercing friendly and don't fall off.
Cons: Sound needs to be tweaked a bit
This is an updated version of the product I had before which, fell apart. These, however, are sturdier than the others I had. They definitely fixed the floppyness of the previous ones. This one, has less range than the previous ones and more interference. Not so much to be annoyed about. All and all, I'm content with the purchase.

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Great value for the money
Cons: Nothing
I purchased these back around Christmas and love them. Mainly used to watch TV at night. Never knew how much I was missing especially when it came to watching sitcoms. Little hard of hearing in one ear and these are great. Don't need to turn up the TV and the wife can sleep!

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: I got it at a reduced price!
Cons: Had problems setting it up because I had satellite television
I am very happy with my purchase. I love the fact that I can have my television on mute and still hear the program. I am hard of hearing and need the television on very loud. I live in a apartment type condo where you can hear your neighbors televion. Since I work 2nd shift and need to unwind at night watching television I can wear these without disturbing anyone. The people at Best Buy helped me with my online purchase because the price changed at checkout for some reason.

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: It's OK but could be better.
Item.Review:
Pros: OK sound
Cons: loss of connectivity
I have poor hearing from the military. The sound is ok, but I'm not a great judge for that. It can lose connectivity easily when your head is resting on a pillow or head rest.

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: Light weight, fits comfortable, and has listening range thru out the house. My bride and I sit approximately 12 feet apart in the evenings, each listening to our own TV's. Sometimes it becomes a volume war. Thanks to the product, the war is over.

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Not one thing
Cons: Everything
My Rocketfish wireless headphones are perfect in regards to sound, but not as comfortable as the Sony listed here. That being said, there was a constant hiss/static coming from these headphones and I was only 15 feet from my brand new flatscreen LCD TV. These are not worth the time or effort, and I returned them today trust me, I use wireless headphones every single night in bed, and these are AWFUL!!!! If they offered a zero star rating I would give it to these.

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: No cords & good quality sound!
My wife can't sleep with the noise of the TV & I can't sleep w/o something to take my mind off of my day. This has solved the problem of fighting over the volume of the TV @ night.

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy to set up
Cons: Lack of trouble shooting information in manual
These headphones are great! For those others who complain about headset not working after a few minutes, you must have the sound turned up on the unit you have the base plugged into. At first, our headset stopped working every ten minutes. I did a search on Sony's web site for this product and learned that if the sound was turned down low on the receiver, after 10 minutes the base would read as if it was not getting a signal and automatically cease transmitting. I simply turned the volumn up and the headset is GREAT! Great sound, and very comfortable. I love the automatic on and off feature built in. I would buy this product again and again. Tommorrow I plan to purchase a set for my brother's birthday.

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: If you like an $100 paper weight, buy this now.
Item.Review:
Pros: Absolutely nothing!!!
Cons: Pretty much everything.
The sound is horrible most of the time, there are times that they do sound good. I would expect the sound would come across clearly all the time for $100. Once in a while there is a clicking noise and you have to adjust the headphones just right on your head to make the clicking noise to quit. When I get up to go the kitchen to get a drink the headset comes alive with a whole lot of static. My kitchen is the next room over from the headphone base. A week ago the headset clicked and shut off and I cannot get them back on. Dead in the water and I only had them for a little over a year. I only use these headphones when I stay up, with wife is in bed. (few times a week tops) I wanted to add a negative star for the Sony cus ... tomer service. I tried to call them and let me tell you that their customer service it terrible. They are happy that you purchased their products but anything else they could care less the problems you are having. DO NOT BUY SONY!!!! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Freedom: no more pesky cords!
Cons: N/A
I was tired of the wire all over my desk. Every time I went to type or use my mouse it was in my way. And especially when playing a game and trying to use my joystick. My joystick is wireless so it only made sense that my headphones needed to be wireless also. Very high quality sound and no static or droupouts. I was worried because they were "shutting off" at first just like some othe reviewers claimed. I turned up the main volume through my sound card (need to turn volume on headphones down first!) and problem was solved!!

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Sound was good
Cons: Battery Cost $33 for one
My headphones went crack and just died......I thought maybe it was the batteries because they were hot, so I went looking and looking and found some in Finland, none at the Sony website but at Radio Shack... they were $33 for one....Holy cr*p......I will go get a new set other than Sony and I will check the battery type before I buy....

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy installation
Cons: so far no problems
The headset is easy to use.Just plug in, charge the battery. Put them on and your good to go. You can listen to programs, movies, music, from any room in the house, without any lose of power. It's great to be able to hear the program, without blasting everyone out of the house. Sit back, relax and enjoy the show.

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I have been searching for a wireless headphone set since my last one stopped working. I found the set I wanted at a local store then went online to O.com and found it for twenty dollars less. It is exactly what I was looking for ,has great sound quality and I couldn't be more pleased. I like to do my house and yard work and be able to listen to my music at the same time. One little kink is that I sometimes have to turn my head to get it to tune in because of studs in the house or maybe its the other electrical products running but it is a minor adjustment compared to the overall quality. I love it. I give it five stars. ...

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: very comfortable, separate volume control
Very pleased with the sound quality, range, and comfort. Easy set up, and long battery life. Also allows for listening to TV with TV volume on as well as headsets being worn (good for people with different volume preferences).

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: speaker, have a poor sound, but this is not the main problem. cellphone and wifi make strange weird cracking, and every parts of the headphone squeeze with a lot sound every time a muscle of your face make a small movement

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: Purchased this for use on TV. Nice comfortable head set, good range and sound quality. Comes with audio hookup cables. Setup instructions so simple they leave out the fact that you won???t hear anything unless you put the headphones on your head! I see why many may have thought that they had a defective unit. There is a sensor in the head strap that turns it off when you take it off your head. Nice product for the price.

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Clear, Full sound, Wireless signal is strong.
Cons: Needs more bass, signal has a bind spot
1.) The headset does clicks in place. That means you know its properly in place and will remain in its place. Which is very important for the charging process. After the headset is broken in the headset will become out of adjustment and that can cause problems when placing the headset back on the stand. Proper placement is required for the unit to charge.
2.) The unit is clear signal strength but it has a blind spot. You have to face or face away to get clearest signal. I work at a desk were the TV is to the left. That causes a slight static hiss. I corrected the hiss by reversing the headset right headphone - to - left ear ect. Acoustic had this same issue too. So I think ... its just were the antenna
3.) The headset is steady and is confortable. There is a resting section that makes the unit feel lighter.
4.) Sound is full and seems to have potential of being a great headset if you use a system with your headphones. I wish it had more explosive sound and bass
Sony headset seem address all the problems Acoustic Research didn't. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: These headphones are very comfortable and sound great! Very easy to install. The built in charger ensures they are always ready to go. Highly recommend these headphones.

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: Mom has lost most of her hearing after 50 years of teaching Piano. I noticed even with the TV at full volume she could not follow the story line and would fall asleep. These head phones did the trick the first time she put them on her eyes opened wide and a huge smile appeared. Dad now can turn down the TV and she is re-discovering all the old movies. Easy to hook up. Soft and light on the head and with the auto on and auto off I don't have to worry about her running down the battery. The charger works great no muss no fuss. This is important for people in there 80's

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: perfect for my needs
Cons: haven't found anything yet.
I don't know what the fuss is about. Even though I have only had these headphones a few days, they work great. You would expect a sony product to exceed standards. I use mine on my television and the sound is great. I have used others before that I got from Radio Shack but these far exceed those. These fit my head perfectly, but what i really like about them is there is not an on/off button. they turn on automatically when I put them on my head. Another great feature is the sound is independent of the TV. If someone turns the volume up on the TV it doesn't affect the headphones. the tv can be on mute and sound will still come through the headphones until you take them off. I hope these will last but I will definitel ... y buy these again and again. Ba hum bug to all the other complainers. Some people can never be pleased. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: They seem pretty durable
Cons: Horrible Frequent Static
The audio quality of these wireless cans are horrible, period. There is no getting around the perpetual static. Buy the Rocketfish 2.4 Ghz cans for $20 less, Rocketfish wireless cans have excellent audio quality. The Sony cans boast a 150 ft range, and you'll get 150 ft of absolutely staticky nightmare. I returned these cans and bought the Rocketfish.
DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY ON THESE HORRIBLE HEADPHONES.

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Comfort, Technology
Cons: The SOUND
The Sony phones fit nicely, the idea of the of auto on and off was great, but then i charged them up, connected them to the TV, but the sound was just HORRIBLE and TINNY! They sounded like an old table top portable radio with a small speaker, or better yet, like an iPod touch playing through it's own speaker. I purchased a set of RCA 900 MHz from Best Buy several years ago, and they were THE BEST, but the support head strap broke, (the plastic cover became dried out, and hurt my head to wear them, then the side support just fell off,) and they only way to use them was by placing something under the top brace, so the ear pieces would stay at ear level, those earpieces were uncomfortable after awhile, as I used these daily for late-nigh ... t TV viewing. I saw the Sony head phones, and another pair at the store for $119, and like the Sony, when i read the box. The other head set, ROCKETFISH looked just like the old RCA's that failed so i didn't want them. The best thing about the RCA phones was the fabulous sound from highs, mid-range and deep soft lows, and expected at least the same sound from the Sony, but it wasn't to be. I tested both the new Sony headphones and then put on the old RCA headphones, one after the other, and the old RCA's sounded far superior. I am returning them and they were only tested for one minute! I did purchase the protection plan, even though I never do, only because of the problem with the RCA's, but I don't think the RCA's would have even been out of warranty when the problem occurred. I have heard, used and owned many headphones since the 1970's, I usually review products before purchase, but this time i didn't. I have always owned higher end products as you get what you pay for and when it comes to sound equipment, I WANT IT TO SOUND LIVE, the SONY headphones DID NOT! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I only have this headset for two weeks, but they are very confortable and light weight. I had previously gone through 2 pair of another manufacturer, both which broke. I found these to have a longer distance from the source with no distortion. (through two rooms and onto my deck)I also like the fact they are chargedthrough induction, so I no longer have the problem of not getting the headset seated properly as before. Also, the charge lasts much longer than my old sets.(more than eight hours). I believe the auto shutoff has a lot to do with that.

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: Good design but not perfoming as expected
Item.Review: i used this headphones from past one week. Pros- Good design,confortable on ears,free from wires. Cons- frequent hissy noise and hissy noise increase if you move ur head or go little far from the transmtter.

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Excellent sound, great quality
I use these headphones with my LCD TV when watching at night so I don't keep the family awake. Sound is still crystal clear after about 2 years of heavy use. I've had the sound cut out maybe once or twice in all this time, but it came right back. Comfortable, great sound, lasting charge...definitely recommend.

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Good Sound Quality. Easy to install and use.
Cons: Long battery charging time.
Compared to the RCA 900 Mhz wireless headphones that I had previously, these headphones are terrific. The sound quality is very good for 900Mhz headphones with good range and minimum noise. They are very comfortable but have to be placed vertically on your head in order for the auto power-on feature to work.

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: No wires to drag around
Cons: Stopped working in 3 weeks
Sony Wireless Headphones I thought that I would take a chance on getting a pair that would work, even though the reviews said some cut off every 10-20 minutes. Mine worked great for 3 weeks, then the cut offs started. Real easy to reboot, just cycle the power & the RF came back in 1-2 seconds. The headphones stayed on, it's the base transmitter that shuts it's power off every 10-20 minutes. You have to get up, walk over to the plug, unplug it & then plug it back in, Then resume what you were doing. Repeat and repeat and repeat, just not worth the hassle. Went back to my wired Sony headphones.
I hope that Sony will fix what ever is causing the loss of power.

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: Zero Stars==Not Worth $100 of My Money
Item.Review:
Pros: LOOKED NICE IN THE PACKAGE
Cons: DOES NOT WORK LONGER THAN FIVE MINUTES.
As someone else said in their review, this cheap stuff is not worth $100 of my hard earned money. I was happy to buy this to go with my wide screen LCDHDTV and set THEM up, charged them 16 hrs until the light went out and put them on to enjoy and 'POOF!'--no sound. Sound shut off light a light switch. Doesn't work on the surround sound system or directly on the HDTV input jack. Just keeps shutting off. No channel comes in. Clicked back on twice for a few minutes and after the thrid time (trying different head set chanels,, I just said to myself "I ain't giving these people a dime of my money." I bought a cheap set of wireless phones for $20 five years ago that lasted fine for years. This whole prod ... uct is just very cheap plastic and suffocating earphone pads that are very uncomfortably hot after five minutes. This "wireless headphones" is cheap and most importantly a piece of plastic that doesn't work. Period. Taking it back for a full refund, tomorrorw. VERY BAD, WORTHLESS PRODUCT JUST HUSSTLING ON THE SONNY NAME. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: Good headphones if you will use it in same room where transmitter is and if you will not move your head at all. If you go in room that has two walls in between transmitter and headphones, but less then 10m away sound start to get noises and interruptions. Other than that build quality and choice of materials (plastic) is really bad. It makes so much annoying noises that makes listening of music almost impossible.

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: Can sometimes have alot of interference. Not sure if this is related to other wireless products being close by or not. They are comfortable and the battery lasts a good while. Not sure if I would buy again or not.

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: everything.
Cons: nothing.
i've had this product for a few years now.. at least 3.5 and i love it! still works great. i have a roommate that works days, i work evenings.. and when i watch tv in bed he isn't disturbed. the sound is fine, the comfort is fine, still works/looks like new.

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy to set up
Cons: Not enough bass
To the people who say the headset shuts off randomly: The base transmitter will turn off after 15 minutes with no input signal. It will also turn off or fail to turn on if the input signal is too weak. Increase the volume of your signal source if you're having issues with the headphone transmitter turning off or failing to turn on.
Regarding sound quality: The best sounding wireless headphones I ever had were infrared Koss Kordless Model JCK/200 phones, which I owned in the 1980s. I've had various brands of RF headphones since then, and the sound has never lived up to the quality of the old Koss infrared units.

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Attractive
Cons: Dont Work At All
I purchased these for my father. We followed the directions exactly. The battery was supposed to be fully charged after @ 16 hrs. Twenty-one hours later it still wasn't charged.

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: IT'S WIRELESS & LONG RANGE SIGNAL
Cons: NOTHING
I don't understand why this product got a low review. I have a lot of devices set up on my tv & I don't have any problems or interference. It really lives the name SONY.

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Very Comfortable
Cons: annoying static and noise
I bought this a couple of days ago and took it home, all excited to use it, but I read the manual and it said to charge it for 16 hours! I let it charge all night and all of the next day. As soon as I got home from work I turned on my PS3 and put on the headphone, I was very impressed with how comfortable it was, and I like the fact that when you put it on your head, it automatically turns on. I set the channel and started to listen... Disappointment!!
The sound had so much static and noise, and there was a ticking noise every second. I returned it immediately and got a Bose headphone (wired), which was way better. Save yourself some money and time DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT!!

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Comfortable fit around ears
Cons: Not the best sound quality
I hesitated buying this at first due to the lack of information on the packaging but now love it. It's easy to set up just plugging it into your tv's output. There are no on/off buttons on the headphones because it automatically turns on and off when you put it on and take it off. It's great because you won't accidently drain the battery by forgetting to turn it off. I have a Sony tv and I have to turn the volume to the second bar in order to get any volume from the headphones. At 2 bars, you can't hear anything from the tv so don't worry about noise. Overall, it's not Bose sound quality you'll be getting from this headphone but it's better than radio quality. It's easy to use and rarely gets sound interferenc ... e. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: sound, confortable, wireless, rechargeable
Cons: I cannot say anything not good about this product
I use these headphones to watch TV without disturbing others sleeping. They feel great and sound great. And it is great not to be connected by wires.

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Comfort on the ears
Cons: Everything. Sound quality is terrible, constant static and white noise.
Bought them to play video games without waking anyone up. Thought $100 was a good price for wireless headphones. I was wrong. These things are the biggest waste of money I have ever spent.

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: Great for watching TV without disturbing others!
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy to set up & use
Cons: The base has to be plugged into the TV and the headphones put back on the base
I use them because I have limited mobility and hearing issues. They do the job well and i think it was money well spent

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: Just try to find a replacement battery
Item.Review:
Pros: Decent Enough Sound Quality
Cons: Battery Replacement Is Difficult
I've enjoyed these for at least a year or more, but when the rechargeable battery (BP-HP550-11) would no longer keep a charge, I had a TIME finding a new one. No search of the Sony site could find it. Yet the manual insists that it must use this battery that's not commercially available. Using suggested commercially available dry AAA batteries will not allow you to re-charge in the charger and certainly won't last as long as their hard-to-find battery.

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I purchased these for my husband who loves to stretch out on the floor at night and watch Fox News when I go to bed, but he is a little hard of hearing now and therefore there was always a little tension about the volumn!! These were for both of us and to probably save a 47 year marriage and they worked wonderfully! He enjoys his late night tv and I can read and sleep in peace!!!

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: auto shut off
Cons: not comfortable
works great for when someones sleeping next to you but is made cheaply and not that comfortable when wearing. also putting it on the charger is a pain and probably will break something eventually. Dont think this product will be last in the long run.

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I bought this for my dad and my husband and I think this is the best Christmas present ever. No more loud surround sound at home. Quality is really good and if you connect direct from satellite receiver is better, than just from TV.

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: Great sound, easy to set up
Item.Review: Simple plug & play set up. Good sound quality. Comfortable to wear. You can listen to TV without disturbing others, and walk around the house, still listening from another room. My husband can watch TV while I read or work nearby without being disturbed. No more Honey, please turn the volume down -- he's happy, I'm happy!

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: The first 15 minutes of use
Cons: EXTREMELY SHORT BATTERY LIFE 15 MINUTES
These headphones have never held a charge. Purchased for elderly mother in law who kept her television so loud due to poor hearing that neighbors complained. Had high hopes that this would be the solution but was extremely disappointed when she complained they were not working after I hooked them up(I precharged them for 24 hours before bringing to her house). Initially thought she wasn't charging properly but after bringing them to my house I experienced the same problem. Charge lasted only 15 minutes at the most after charging for over 24 hours. She purchased a cheap pair of corded headphones and loves them.

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Lightweight, comfortable, Big Earcups
Cons: No outside sound blockage
I bought this for tv listening so that I don't have to have the sound blaring and bother the others in the family. These headphones are by far the best that I have found (I tried several including the stethoscope type). I have large ears so the extra large earcups are great for me. The only downside is that since they are loose fitting they let in outside noise, but that is not usually a problem. I wish that I had tried these first.

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: well not rele worth a hundred bucks...
Item.Review:
Pros: easy to set up, pretty comfortable, takes AAA batteries as well as the rechargable
Cons: price, huge and look pretty rediculous on most ppl, no way to adapt it so it can be pluged directly to the pc

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: It was a little disturbing that a great company like SONY would manufacture such a low quality device. Lacking of bass, and higer frequency details are the least I have to mention. It makes my ear hurt. After a long time using this earphone, I feel dizzy! I live in an metropolitan arpartment building, where radio signal interferences are common. I sometimes pickup neighbors' wireless phone conversations while other times receive annoying white noises. For the money, it's not that bad. At least it gives me freedom to walk around without wires. I think I'll buy a higher end one.

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: Purchased these while deployed for the convenience of not being attached by a wire to the computer or PS3 while in my wooden room. I was all excited to receive them but be heartbroken. The headphones are very comfortable, and the do fade outside noise because of the think cushion on the ear cups, but sound that is where I was crushed. The trebble and voice distord very easy, and the bass.... WHAT BASS? The description of Deep Bass is a lie, I have another Sony model Earbud Style headphones (MDR-EX55/BLK) which hit so much deeper and richer in the bass department. I have had the Sony Earbuds for close to 4 years and they are the best 39.99 I have spent.. I am a sony geek, TV,s, Laptops, Playstations (from the very first PSOne in 1996 to the PS3.. thes headphones are not worth $99 or the &am ... p;79 in the Refurb department. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: Good for the money. Not for audiophiles.
Item.Review: These headphones are pretty good. They get the job done, but if you want a dynamic surround sound experience go with something else. Also, if the sound quality is staticky then lower the volume on the headphones and turn up the volume on the receiver. It clears it up.

i figured it would be a safe buy - sony brand. but that was not the case. there was a static no matter how i adjusted it. bass just was not good. i returned them less than a day later

Item.Item: Sony MDR RF970RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I have used the product. it is a great headphone especially when you have to watch TV in quiet surroundings but not to sacrifice your enjoyment from the sound volume. my son likes it too and he is asking it for his Xmas gift.
